summary: The Post-9/11 GI Bill pays tuition, housing, and other costs for veterans pursuing higher education. It has provided $94 billion in benefits to veterans since 2009. This testimony examines which schools are receiving the most Post-9/11 GI Bill tuition payments, how their students are faring, and how school closures affect veterans. 50 schools received over 30% of all tuition payments—$1.4 billion—and enrolled over 190,000 veterans...
title: Post-9/11 GI Bill: Veterans Affected by School Closures
